We have so many history conserved.Hey buddy,have a look at these cool places

Laxmi Vilas Palace - 
address - Gate No.2 Laxmi Vilas Palace Estate, J.N.Marg, Vadodara, Gujarat 390001
phone - 085111 16908
det - The term Maharaja Palace actually refers to a series of palaces in Vadodara, Gujarat, India, constructed since the Gaekwad, a prominent Maratha family, started ruling the Baroda State.
Architectural style: Indo-Saracenic Revival architecture opened - 1890
https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-s/04/4b/53/de/palace-front.jpg

2)Kirti Stambh -  Palace Rd, Shiyabaug, Babajipura, Vadodara, Gujarat 390001.
det - "Kirti Stambh", Tower of Fame/Triumph, is located in the city of Vadodara, Gujarat state, western India.
https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/2d/Kirti_stambh.jpg

3)Sur Sagar lake also known as the Chand Talao is a lake situated in middle of the city of Vadodara in the State of Gujarat in India. The lake was rebuilt with stone masonry in the 18th Century. The water in this lake remains in it for the whole year. A concrete wall surrounds the lake on which the people use to sit.
http://photos.wikimapia.org/p/00/00/82/29/14_big.jpg

4)Sayaji Baug -
	Address: Near Kala Ghoda, Vinoba Bhave Road, Sayajigunj, Vadodara, Gujarat 390005
	Phone: 094411 43740
	det - Sayaji Baug is a garden located in Vadodara, Gujarat, India. Sayaji Baug was dedicated to the citizens of Vadodara by Maharaja Sayaji Rao Gaekwad III in 1879. Sayajirao III built Sayaji Baug, well known as Kamati Baug, on the river Vishwamitri.
https://vmc.gov.in/images/KalaGodha.jpg
